comment: Great teacher, but a lot of reading

This class is only interesting if you have a burning passion for law, which Fallaw definitely does. He has extensive knowledge about the subject. Lectures are dense but the powerpoint helps a lot. DEFINITELY READ THE BOOK. That made a dramatic difference in my test results. DO NOT SKIP ANY HOMEWORK. He does not let you make up. READ READ READ!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I barely went to class but I made an A. He allowed a cheat sheet for his online webcam tests. I also did all of the extra credit assignments. 1 homework assignment per week and 5 exams.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Fallaw truly is passionate about what he teaches but his lectures were sometimes difficult to pay attention to and the tests were always very detailed. He offers some extra credit but you have to do all the homework's and have to study hard to do well on the exams if you want to make an A.

All he does in class is read straight off the powerpoint so there's really no use in going to class. Every test you can have a cheat sheet and there is always a bonus opportunity. I got Cs on every test and did all the bonus and did all the online assignments and i got a B in the class without much effort
Really boring class. Probably a great guy just not a great professor. Exams are difficult but its mainly memorization and application. I think the course itself sucks rather than him

Professor Fallaw is a professor that I would NEVER take again. Lectures are straight from the PowerPoints, and hes super dry and bland. There are 5/6 tests AND a final. Weekly LearnSmarts due that he refuses to let you make up unless youre dying with proof. Tests are nothing like the PowerPoints, made to completely trick you. 32 EC points total.

Four tests and a cumulative final. Easy as long as you actually read the slides. Each test you get a one page front only cheat sheet. Final you get front and back cheat sheet. Lockdown webcam for tests and final. Dont have to go to class day of the tests. Tests and final are open for 24 hours day of test. 40 questions on tests, 100 for final.

While I truly think Prof Fallaw a nice guy, he is one of the worst professors I have ever had. He reads straight off the slide and exams are lockdown AND webcam and extremely hard. Nothing like whats on the slides. His questions are wordy and hard to comprehend and it honestly seems as if he could care less about his students.
